content: SDSL Homepage Opening Members Teaching Publication Research SDSL Home SDSL Home Research Publication Teaching Members Opening Secure Decentralized Systems Lab The mission of Secure Decentralized Systems Lab (SDSL) at University of Kentucky Computer Science is to build communication and computing paradigms that are secure, usable, and require minimal involvement of trusted third parties. We develop security/privacy mechanisms for emerging decentralized applications and decentralized alternatives to traditional systems, leveraging techniques from distributed computing, cryptography, protocol design, and new hardware capabilities. Decentralization is not our ultimate goal; rather, it is a guiding principle for building resilient systems that can thrive in dynamic, adversarial environments. SDSL is directed by Dr. Yang Xiao and receives funding support from NSF. Research Interests Decentralized systems — consensus protocol security and usability, decentralized identity and access management. Autonomous IoT — secure communication, security mechanisms for collaborative autonomy, distributed machine learning. Mobile networks — subscriber privacy and scam prevention, authentication, spectrum access management. News ◾  08/2025: Our collaborative NewSpectrum project has been awarded by the NSF.
